name: Chaos
description: This algorithm generates chaotic CVs according to a variety of so-called ‘attractors’, including the well-known Lorenz equations [60]. Each generates three CVs, named X, Y, and Z, which are available on separate outputs. You can modify the parameters of the Lorenz equation – ‘Rho mod’ affects 'r' (aka 'ρ'), and ‘Beta mod’ affects 'b' (aka 'β'). With the values at 0V, the parameters are the classic values as studied by Lorenz (28 and 8/3 respectively).
use_cases: Generating chaotic control voltages for modular synthesizers
Exploring mathematical attractor behavior in audio/visual contexts
Dynamic patching and experimental sound design
gui_description: The display shows a graphical representation of the outputs, projected onto the X/Y, X/Z, and Y/Z planes.

input_ports.name: Reset input
input_ports.description: A positive-going edge here resets the system to the values given by the Reset X/Y/Z parameters.

output_ports.name: X output
output_ports.description: Outputs the chaotic CV for the X coordinate of the attractor.

output_ports.name: Y output
output_ports.description: Outputs the chaotic CV for the Y coordinate of the attractor.

output_ports.name: Z output
output_ports.description: Outputs the chaotic CV for the Z coordinate of the attractor.
